newsitem.title: USA: Turner Broadcasting exec to resign - report.
newsitem.headline: Turner Broadcasting exec to resign - report.

text.p: Scott Sassa, president of Turner Broadcasting System Inc's Turner Entertainment Group and a member of Turner Broadcasting's board of directors, will resign his post, Daily Variety reported Tuesday.
The resignation is the first executive shake-up since the merger between Turner Broadcasting and Time Warner Inc was approved by the Federal Trade Commission last week.
The trade paper, quoting unnamed industry sources, said the move was the result of the expected appointment of TBS executive vice president Terrence McGuirk to chairman of TBS.

Variety said its sources estimated Sassa's settlement to be at least $2 million, which includes his salary and bonus remaining on his contract. He also has 328,395 shares and stock options, which were worth $9.2 million at TBS' closing price Monday, the article said.
